content.label: You can’t believe that both the website and app can benefit from large gaps between accounts or menu choices- I’ve had to zoom out of the web page and doing a funds transfer on my iPhone 11 Pro is ridiculous, with 6 drop downs or blanks not fitting on one page or even close to it. Makes errors easier and operation annoying. And they dropped the color coding of deposits vs withdrawals. Who signed off on these changes?? 2 steps forward...
I don’t like it. I have to scroll continuous to see what I used to be able to see on a single page. This new layout is cumbersome and wastes my time.

title.label: Frost used to be number one in local service

content.label: I can not rate their service as satisfactory.  Because of their seemingly high turn over in staff, no one knows who you are nor do they care that you are a long-standing customer.
I much preferred the previous look of the app that had more lines/delineation and blues and grays mixed in as opposed to just the stark white background.  It’s boring, unappealing and harder to read.

I’m a fan of the outstanding customer service at Frost, but technology has never been their strong suit and this app update proves it.  For my use, there are zero improvement for the banking aspects of the app.  The app changes are simply a white background and a lot more blank space.  I like the layout of the old app much better- I could see more information at once.  The new one requires much more scrolling for no apparent reason other than some consultant told their tech team that this was a more modern look and feel.  Maybe so, but it’s harder to use.  I was excited when they announced the new app, but this “upgrade” is disappointing.

Cleaner and more modern, but would prefer the swipe back gesture to take you back and not open the menu. I want to go in and out of accounts without reaching up to the top of the screen (requires two hands). Have the menu appear via a click of a hamburger.
Everything works really well for me, I have no complaints.

The app functionality is fine, but the update puts design style far over usability (at least on iPhone 7 Plus screen).
There’s too much negative space to scan transactions by eye. You have to scroll back and forth and keep track of numbers in your head. And why does my name have to take up top quarter of the screen? Am I going to forget? 
The contrast on day separators is too low :(
After all that whining, the fonts are much better :)
Love this app and love this Bank! They actually listen to customer feedback!

title.label: New design is all form no function

content.label: Really disappointed in the new design. Terrible use of both color and space. Looking at an account you can now only see 3-7 transactions on screen at a time due to a substantial amount of unnecessary space within the list items. You used to be able to see upwards of 12-15. To make it worse the color in the sub headers for the date of transaction is such a light shade of gray you can hardly see it. They’ve severely reduced the amount of information that is visible on screen while also destroying the visual hierarchy of what information is still visible.
Let’s me log in, then the app closes. Let me have the old version back, it always worked fine.
Now it looks like when you pay at an iPad station or as a restaurant ‘s menu.
Just downloaded new version and now it will not open on my iPad.

When I log in it tells me to download the latest version. I press “update now”. It takes me to the apple App Store, but a new version is not available. I’ve reset my phone a couple times but still no change. Earlier in the day I could log in without this update version. Now it pops up every time i log in. Seems like this started after midnight. Not sure if this is Frost or Apple.

Please integrate with password managers for logging in! Copy/paste isn’t even allowed for the user and password, making this an extremely frustrating experience if you use complex passwords generated by a password manager (which everyone should be doing).
Doesn’t even open half the time
The app is not letting me log in anymore with the most recent update! What’s happening?!

Opened app on my iPad, most of my finances are done on my iPad.

It would be beneficial, if the app was also made to take advantage of the landscape position of the iPad.

It is really un-helpful when switching to the frost app, and the next thing I have to do is flip my iPad after detaching my key board from my Zagg Rugged Case, to view the app right side up instead of sideways.

 I would not use this app on my iPad, until this inconvenience is remedied.

title.label: Why do I have to register every time I login?

content.label: I just updated the app and for some crazy reason, it is asking me to “register” my account every time I try to login. This is really annoying and inconvenient and I don’t understand why the passcode that I have set up a million times already isn’t working.

This app is very out of date. It does not allow for password managers built in to iOS or for copy and paste of passwords from a manager app. 

Additionally, there is not support for larger devices like iPads. It is just a low resolution window-paned app.
Great bank; horrible app. Wouldn't even open with my brand XS iphone.

Can you please add support for password managers. Or at the VERY least allow pasting of text into the password field. Security researchers have concluded that supporting password managers is more secure than not as it encourages the use of randomly generated secure passwords.
Performs nicely for what I need it for. Acts as an aggregation service for investments, retirement, cc’s, mortgages, etc.

So many times when logging in I get a pop up saying my network is slow, this is with my iPhone X, (facial recognition) then it won’t even let me login manually, it’s so frustrating! I can login about 60% of the time when I’m at a mall or store. Shouldn’t it be most of time? And I get kicked off when I try to make mobile deposits. 

They need to fix these things because Frost is a great bank. They are behind the times with their technology though.

I recently moved to San Antonio and after 15 years with Chase jumped ship to Frost after seeing what amazing customer service they have. I am also extremely happy with their app! It is always current and has a beautiful user interface. I’m 5 stars for this app and bank.
Most banks won’t charge an overdraft under $5 but they charged me for 2 for 2 .99 cent charges from Apple and would not refund my account. I’m very disappointed in them

Is there a reason I haven’t been able to view my external accounts on the app in a few days? I thought it might’ve been a small issue that would get resolved next time I logged in but it hasn’t resolved.

title.label: Works well but could use some improvement.

content.label: For the bill pay is suggest changing it so that you have the option to schedule it to send out based on the delivery date or at least show the deliver date. Currently you can only see the delivery date on the confirmation page, after that it’s just gone. You also can’t edit the bill pay even if it’s scheduled in advanced, you just have to delete it and start over.

Hi. I use a password manager 1password. I cannot login to the app because i am not allowed to paste my password. Please make it so i can paste my password into the password field.  Why no copy/paste? Get your product owners on this simple feature!!

Works great on my iPad with my 4-digit security code.  But iPhone does not recognize that security code and demands that I provide my debit card number and password. Well ... I declined the debit card and atm card.  I just want to use the app so I am out of luck.

I have 18 character random generated secure password. With the latest update the app forgot my previous settings and will not let me paste in my secure password. 
Not very smart or secure.

Extremely displeased with Frost. I have been a customer for almost 10 years and I had high hopes for Frost thinking that it would keep up with this digital era we are in today. Not only is frost astonishly late to digital wallet but it constantly declines for minor purchases when there is definitely room in the bank. You’ve lost a customer.
This app always shows more than what I actually have in my account causing me to spend more than what I have!
This version does not seem to work on an Ipad. I need an Ipad version more that’s an Iphone version. Please create one.

Many people normally use password managers to login and the app doesn’t allow you to use them or even to paste a password, which is a big issue. I hope they fix this. I wish you all would also tie directly into password managers.
Switched phones, super easy to set up and get going. Kudos to your app dev team!

Don't get me wrong this app is well layout yet I have rest my password many times because when I try to login it is incorrect.  If anyone else is having this problem please write a review so they will have a better chance to see this. It's always says my login pin is incorrect yet I know it's correct.

title.label: Doesn’t allow anyone to go out

content.label: They have a nightly maintenance around 1:00 when anyone is out at a bar that doesn’t allow you to access their own account. Updates on account amount are always off and make me spend more than I actually have on my account.
Love it
User friendly, everything you need in an app

I have been using the app on my IPad and on my Android phone for about a year.  It works well and is very convenient for my purposes. I have never had any issues with the app, and have only been unable to access if it is down for maintenance, which is very seldom. Thanks, Frost Bank. I have been a very satisfied customer for 30 years.  And, NO, Frost Bank did not pay me for this review.

You can’t paste your password, doesn’t connect to password managers, and it clears your password when you switch apps (trying to remember a few characters at a time). How are you supposed to use a secure, unique password for a FINANCIAL app?

Also, you can’t have a personal and business account t on the same device without some major speed bumps.
I won’t use this app until copy and paste of username/password is implemented.

Works fine but wish the app offered budgeting tools and maybe automatic round up savings for daily transactions... Would really like to see the budgeting tools so i can see my income/expenses on a chart without using a third party app that is almost never able to sync with my frost account... Also would be nice if the availability of mobile deposits was more prompt... Most banks are instantaneous with their mobile deposits.

I live in Keller DFW, and the location map is San Antonio. The app is the cause. I have to put my zip code in the search bar to find a ATM. It use to use my location on the map. I don’t care how many banks and ATM you have in San Antonio. I don’t Live there. Yes I have location on in my settings for this app. One extra star for great customer service! I have been a member for at least 20yrs or more. Taking my 1 star away. You have to have a nickname to send a review on this app. Yep 10 attempts and still searching for a nickname.

When entering your password to log into the app, you can’t use copy/paste. And when you switch apps and come back, it erases whatever partial username/password you started to enter. Doing this discourages complex passwords, which is absolutely ridiculous for a banking app!

title.label: Everything is seamless and smooth except...

content.label: Notifications. Would be nice to have some sort of option. For now I use a workaround where the website sends me a summary of any transaction over 1 dollar, but that’s clunky and not real time. Would be nice to help customers avoid over drawing.

As has been mentioned, not allowing pasting of passwords actually DISINCENTIVIZES good security practices like using a password manager - not very modern or customer friendly. Somehow much bigger banks are able to support this - once again, Frost is frustratingly lagging in technology. Makes it hard to support my “local” bank.

I have a passcode that I can enter and it lets me in without typing in my user id and password each time. The problem is that almost every time it tells me my passcode is incorrect. This can’t be because I use Face ID to log in to the account. So it’s the app that keeps messing up. Please fix this
Easy to navigate and simple interface. Can also see all banking and investment accounts on one page.
